On May 16, 2020, three Perry Middle Students competed in the Lake Erie Regional Power of the Pen tournament against 7th and 8th grade writers from all over northeast Ohio. For the first time in the organization’s over thirty year history, writers competed online. Seventh graders Audrey M.A. and Madelyn R. along with eighth grader Grace M. qualified from the Lake Erie College District tournament to compete in the Lake Erie Regional tournament. All three writers earned superior scores which qualified them for this regional tournament.

The regional awards were announced on May 28, 2020. In the May 16th Regional tournament, Madelyn R. placed 10th out of all of the 7th graders who competed in the region and Grace M. placed 4th out of all of the 8th graders in the tournament.

We are extremely proud of all of our writers. They adapted to a new format and continued to practice their storytelling skills.

Seventh graders Audrey M.A. and Madelyn R. along with eighth grader Grace M. qualified from the Lake Erie College District tournament to compete in the Lake Erie Regional tournament. All three writers earned superior scores which qualified them for this regional tournament.

The regional awards were announced on May 28, 2020. In the May 16th Regional tournament, Madelyn R. placed 10th out of all of the 7th graders who competed in the region and Grace M. placed 4th out of all of the 8th graders in the tournament.

We are extremely proud of all of our writers. They adapted to a new format and continued to practice their storytelling skills.
